blog.name: sweetlittlepeapod
blog.title: Dreams can be dangerous things.
blog.description:
“Real life was something happening in her peripheral vision.”

-------------------------------------------

So this blog is mostly Shadowhunters trash but in-amongst that is a mixture of Marvel - Katya - Supernatural - Game Of Thrones - The Walking Dead - Bianca Del Rio - Lord Of The Rings - The Hobbit - McFly - Sleeping At Last - Gilmore Girls - Adore Delano - Criminal Minds - Dirk Gently - The Handmaiden's Tale - Shiver - Rainbow Rowell - Just to name a few :)

-------------------------------------------

"But right now, you and me here, put together entirely of atoms, sitting on this round rock with a core of liquid iron, held down by this force that seems to trouble you, called gravity, all the while spinning around the sun at 67,000 miles an hour and whizzing through the milkyway at 600,000 miles an hour in a universe that very well may be chasing its own tail at the speed of light; And admist all this frantic activity, fully cognisant of our own eminent demise - which is our own pretty way of saying we all know we’re gonna die - We reach out to one another. Sometimes for the sake of entity, sometimes for reasons you’re not old enough to understand yet, but a lot of the time we just reach out and expect nothing in return. Isn’t that strange? Isn’t that weird?" - David (Martian Child)

-------------------------------------------

  • This made my life<3
  • Meeting two of my idols :)
  • My writing...enter at your own risk!

title: Archaic Kinds Of Fun
body:
What’s the most impossible job you can think of? For Jo Holbrook, The Tank, Killer Extradonaire…it’s being a bodyguard. Leave it to Fury to kick it up a notch. Now she’s playing chauffeur for Tony Stark and trying to figure out where her life went wrong. At least there’s pancakes.

For The Record

November 1, 2014DARCY“Yo, Skye! You in here?!” Darcy called out as she walked into Tony’s lab. She heard music, and she knew Tony wasn’t playing it because he was out on a date with Pepper…

Read more…

trail.content:
After the battle against Ultron

Steve: we all die, you either kill yourself or get killed

Wanda: WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU

body:
*Spoilers for Infinity War*

I realize that I am probably going to sound like about a thousand other wailing fangirls, but I refuse to believe that Loki Odinson/Laufeyson died in Infinity War.

I, too, watched Thanos snap his neck, saying as he dropped him to the floor, “no resurrections.” We all heard Thor admit that it seemed that Loki’s time was finally up. And let’s be honest-not a single person went into that theater fully expecting Loki to live through the movie. We saw it coming. However, it is not the idea of Loki’s death that doesn’t sit right. It’s the way it happened.

There are many, many ways they could have given Loki a proper exit from the MCU (if they are planning on keeping him dead anyway, but more on that later.) Many ways that seem to suit the god of Mischief and Lies much better. What we got, though, was Loki, evidently in a weakened state, attempting to stab Thanos-not only his former boss, but also the current wielder of an Infinity Stone. Loki would know full well how dangerous Infinity Stones are, and how deadly Thanos is on his own. He also would have known better than to attempt to stab him. I realize we all thought it would be funny if Loki went out trying to stab Thanos, but I never actually anticipated for that to be how Loki died in the movie.

Loki is the Trickster god. A master of deception and deceit, clever and cunning and a complete genius. So what I’m trying to say is that, no matter how dire the circumstances were, there is no way Loki would be stupid enough to stab the Mad Titan. Although, frustratingly, Loki’s actual powers are never really discussed in the MCU-we see him performing different feats in every movie, from cryokinesis to illusion casting to shapeshifting and if they are going true to the comics with him being a sorcerer, then why not show the full extent of his powers?-it is obvious that he is powerful, a force to be reckoned with, and that he has quite a bit in his arsenal. Surely, if he intended to kill Thanos, he would have used one of his other abilities in order to actually give him a chance, because knowing the character he probably knew damn well that a knife was going to have almost no effect on Thanos, so why bother? Even in the comics, even when he actually DID die, Loki had carefully planned out everything, and his death was…well, worthy of Loki. Even when he lost his body, when he was dead, he had a plan that was already in motion before he even died. In every adaptation, one of the aspects of Loki that has changed very little is his self preservation. He always saves himself.

(I could honestly go on a roll about how out of character Loki was in both Infinity War and Ragnarok, but that is a lecture for another time.)

So, in Infinity War, he either didn’t die at all (for all we know it could have been an illusion or something, he has shown that ability in the past as well), has a plan to bring himself back to life in some way (Kid Loki? Agent of Asgard? Journey into Mystery? Young Avengers? Anyone?), or it was just poor storylining on the directors/script writers’ end. In THAT case, that would be a truly painful and devastating end to such a complex, fascinating character who proved to be an integral part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Of course, there could be another answer to the Loki problem. I mean, they’ve got a Time Stone that has been shown to reverse death, most rumors and set photos involving Avengers 4 seem to involve time travel, and most of us have probably seen the set pictures of Tom Hiddleston in full Loki getup. (And, of course, there is also the talk that Loki will play an important role in Avengers 4, but I will probably save most A4 theories for a later post if I feel like it.) So for all we know, all the deaths in Infinity War are going to be reversed and the other half of the MCU is going to die. Maybe. Who knows, honestly?

But seriously. If nothing else, we need to get that Loki problem fixed. Superfan or not, everyone who actually knows the character of Loki would know that that was an EXTREMELY un-Loki-like way to die, and I better see that issue resolved, Russos.

blog.name: demigodofhoolemere
blog.title: all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others
blog.description: Karisa. Member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints. Multi-fandom mess, mood often shifts. Entirely too much in love with all manner of shows, movies, and books. Sam Winchester is my lifeblood. Ravenclaw scatterbrain. INFP. ADHD & autistic. Synesthesia & insomnia wrapped in a chronic headache. Big anxious nerd. Have a lovely day! :)

summary: Chris Hemsworth States "Avengers 4" Is More Shocking Than "Infinity War"
title: Chris Hemsworth States "Avengers 4" Is More Shocking Than "Infinity War"
body:
Chris Hemsworth States “Avengers 4” Is More Shocking Than “Infinity War”

The second part to Marvel‘s blockbuster hit Avengers: Infinity War is slated to hit theaters next year. For those who are still in shock by the final scene of the movie, seeing Thanos complete his goal of wiping out half of the universe with just the snap of his finger, Thor‘s Chris Hemsworth has just shared that Avengers 4 will be “even more shocking” than Infinity War. During an interview with…

View On WordPress
